content.webTitle: Digital refocus pushes Kodak to £570m loss

fields.headline: Digital refocus pushes Kodak to £570m loss
fields.bodyText: Eastman Kodak yesterday posted a $1bn (£570m) loss for the third quarter after taking a $900m tax charge related to its restructuring. The company is presently refocusing around digital photography as its traditional film business rapidly disappears. Digital revenue during the third quarter rose 47% to $1.9bn - the first time that the digital division generated more revenue than Kodak's traditional business. Sales of film fell more sharply than Kodak and Wall Street had anticipated, dropping 20% to $1.7bn. The company's shares tumbled 9% as a result.
